Posts.Content: May 28, 2015 09:25AM Northtexas wrote: Stephanie, I understand your dilemma.  I recently became Stage IV after 15 years NED.  I've told very few people and I'm so glad.  Of course you have to tell those closest to you, but you can do that with a positive spin.  If you are feeling good, there's no reason to make a big announcement.  I really feel like it saves me the hastle of talking about my condition constantly and saves loved ones from worry.  I realize that this may change in the future, but why borrow worry and stress.  Wishing you positive treatment results and peaceful, happy days for many, many years!
Posts.Title: Telling (or not telling) friends and family ABeautifulSunset steelrose

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2015 03:51AM Northtexas wrote: That is wonderful!!  So happy for you!! Praying for many more years!!!

Posts.Title: Poll - How old were you when dx with BC Times3 Minetta57

Posts.Content: Northtexas wrote: Hello Ladies, I've been lurking for a little while. I got the news last week that I have bone mets into sternum after 15 years of good news. Of course we are shocked and have been on a roller coaster of emotions. I'm 55 years old, 40 at original diagnosis. My youngest was 4 at first diagnosis. I prayed to see all my girls graduate from high school. I got that plus a precious granddaughter! I'm having ore tests this week and figuring out a plan. A lot of your stories are very uplifting and I pray for all of us in this crappy situation Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: New here and not happy about it. Northtexas Cuculi

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2015 11:01AM Northtexas wrote: thank you ladies for your support!
Posts.Title: New here and not happy about it. Northtexas Cuculi

Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2015 09:26PM Northtexas wrote: you gals are such an inspiration!! Thank you for sharing. I just became iv a week ago, so I am still in testing. Had a abdomen/pelvic scan on Friday, 4/10/15. No results yet. Have a biopsy of sternum tomorrow, where my recurrence showed up. Yeah, I'm nervous and scared. But reading these posts is inspiring to me and I want to thank you all. I'm still trying to wrap my head around all this. My mom died if breast cancer in 1994. I have nightmarish images in my head of going through what she went through. Love you all!
Posts.Title: 15 -20% 5 year survival rate..huh? LeeLee38 JeninMichigan

Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2015 06:38PM Northtexas wrote: Hi sisters, I had a full body bone scan today. Nothing showed up except the sternum area, which we already knew about. I'm happy even though I'm still Stage IV. Every little step in right direction is a win!

Posts.Content: Apr 14, 2015 07:52PM Northtexas wrote: congrats and yea to everyone getting good results! I'm new to iv and am still waiting on scan results. I'm a nervous wreck! I'm not adjusted to this new life as stage iv! I had 15 years of good news and now we're all devastated. I'm empty and lost. I appreciate all your posts but I'm scared to death at this point! Sorry to be a downer!

Posts.Content: May 4, 2015 09:34AM Northtexas wrote: After having 2 CT scans and a bone scan, today I am finally having a PET scan. We know I have a bone met in sternum. MO still trying to figure out pathology since biopsy showed different pathology from original DX. My question, do PET scans normally show more accurately where activity is? I'm scared to death they're going to tell me worse news after this PET scan. Thanks girls!

Posts.Content: May 9, 2015 08:12PM Northtexas wrote: I'm there with you gals. Waiting on results of 3rd biopsy!!! Didn't get enough tissue in first and second biopsy to get full pathology. This is taking so much longer than I expected. Had first CT scan on March 30. Confirmed something in sternum April1. I've had 2 CT Scans, 1 Bone Scan, 1 PET scan, 3 biopsies in the past 6 weeks.

Posts.Content: May 23, 2015 05:49AM Northtexas wrote: I hear you girls!  I've been very selective about who I tell about my DX.  I tell everyone who I do share with that I want NO FB announcements and no public prayer requests. This has made dealing with people much easier.  And I don't have to waste energy talking to people I don't care to talk to.  The ones who are sad faced but then skip away to go on with their life.  Susan

Posts.Content: Northtexas wrote: I'm so confused! I was ILC DX in 2000.  Now after 4 scans and 3 biopsies they say this is a different cancer.....now ductal.  Still IV in sternum.  Has anyone else experienced this?  Also, after 3 biopsies they still cant tell about hormone receptors!!  What?  Seeing MO tomorrow.
